titlePart.text: MECHANICAL PARTS OF CLOCKS OR WATCHES IN GENERAL
TIME-PIECES USING THE POSITION OF THE SUN, MOON, OR STARS
titlePart.entryReference: spring- or weight-driven mechanisms in general
electromechanical clocks with attached or built-in means operating any device at preselected times or after predetermined time intervals
clocks or watches with stop devices

noteParagraph.text: This sub-class includes mechanically-driven calendar clocks or clockwork calendars, and the mechanical part of such clocks or calendars.

titlePart.text: Mechanisms in which the clockwork acts as the driving weight

titlePart.entryReference: arrangements facilitating the removal of the mainspring

titlePart.text: Constructions for connecting the ends of mainsprings with the barrel or the arbor
Protecting arrangements against rupture or overwinding of the mainspring located in the barrel or attached to the barrel
titlePart.entryReference: in connection with keys or the like ,
in connection with automatic winding devices

titlePart.text: Compensation of changes in the motive power of the mainspring
titlePart.entryReference: by mechanical shaping of the mainspring

titlePart.text: with both mainsprings and driving weights
Liquid or gaseous drives for mechanically-controlled secondary clocks
Normal winding of clockworks by hand or mechanically
Winding-up several mainsprings or driving weights simultaneously
Keys or the like with means preventing overwinding
titlePart.entryReference: protecting devices arranged in, or attached to, the barrel
in connection with automatic winding devices
arranged in, or attached to, the barrel

titlePart.text: by mechanical means, e.g. pneumatic motor
titlePart.entryReference: winding-up with electric or electromechanical means

titlePart.text: by self-winding caused by movement of the watch
by oscillating weights the movement of which is limited
by oscillating weights the movement of which is not limited
Supports, suspensions, or guide arrangements, for oscillating weights
Suspension of the oscillating weight at its centre of rotation
by movements of other objects, e.g. by opening hand-bag, by opening case, by opening door
by thermometric, barometric, or like effects or alterations

titlePart.entryReference: arranged in, or attached to, the barrel
in connection with keys or the like
in connection with parts of the cases

titlePart.text: Supervision of the state of winding, e.g. indicating the amount of winding
Devices controlled by such state, e.g. device affording protection against overwinding
titlePart.entryReference: protecting means preventing overwinding arranged in or on the barrel
protecting means in connection with keys or the like
in connection with parts of the cases
in connection with automatic winding devices

titlePart.text: Devices allowing the motion of a rotatable part in only one direction
Pawl constructions therefor, e.g. pawl secured to an oscillating member actuating a ratchet

titlePart.entryReference: electric or magnetic means for converting oscillatory to rotary motion in electromechanical time-pieces

titlePart.text: permanently in contact with the regulating mechanism
with constant impulses for the regulating mechanism
Restricting the amplitude of the lever or the like
Component parts or constructional details, e.g. construction of the lever or the escape wheel
Oscillators acting by gravity, e.g. pendulum swinging in a plane
Oscillators with coil springs stretched and unstretched axially
Oscillators with torsion strips or with springs acting in the same manner as torsion strips, e.g. weight oscillating in a horizontal plane
Compensation of mechanisms for stabilizing frequency
for the effect of variations of temperature
titlePart.entryReference: alloys independent of variations of temperature

titlePart.text: for the effect of variations of atmospheric pressure
for the effect of variations of the impulses
for the effect of unbalance of the weights, e.g. tourbillon
Rotating governors, e.g. centrifugal governors, fan governors
Component parts or constructional details, e.g. collet, stud
for fastening the hairspring onto the balance
Adjusting the beat of the pendulum, balance, or the like, e.g. putting into beat
by setting the collet or the stud of a hairspring
Back-gearing arrangements between gear train and hands
Discs with a single mark or the like
Ornamental shape of the graduations or the surface of the dial
Attachment of graduations to the dial
Selection of materials for dials or graduations
Fastening the dials to the clock or the watch plates
Shiftable dials, e.g. indicating alternately from 1 to 12 and from 13 to 24
Graduations on the crystal or glass, on the bezel, or on the rim
Indicating by numbered bands, drums, discs, or sheets
Arrangements for indicating different local apparent times
by means of additional hands or additional pairs of hands
Clocks or watches with date indicators
characterised by the shape of the date indicator
Devices for setting the date indicators manually
Clocks or watches with indicators for tides, for the phases of the moon, or the like
Adjustable guide marks or pointers for indicating determined points of time
Position of the hands projected optically
Regular striking mechanisms giving the full hour, half hour, or quarter hour
Details of striking mechanisms, e.g. hammer, fan governor
Releasing or locking the regular stroke, e.g. for silence during the night
Winding-up the striking mechanism by the clockwork
Winding-up the clockwork by the striking mechanism
Arrangements producing acoustic signals at preselected times
with coarse and fine setting of the preselected time
adjustable for several preselected times with automatic stopping of the signal
operating on successive days without resetting
operating only once in each 24 hours
Alarm watches to be worn in pockets or on the wrist
titlePart.entryReference: giving signals by stimulating the skin

titlePart.text: Indicating the time by other means or by combined means
Clocks or watches for blind persons
Alarm clocks or watches with devices stimulating the skin
by moving figures, e.g. cuckoo-clock, trumpet clock
Mechanical devices for setting the time-indicating means
by making use of the winding means
by using parts of the case
Frameworks, supports, or arrangements of the clockwork parts in relation to each other, so-called "calibers"
with jewel hole and cap jewel
in which the gear train is arranged in different planes, e.g. parallel or inclined to each other
with seconds hand arranged in the centre of the dial
Calibers of which the mainsprings or barrels are easily removable
with arrangements affording protection of the clockwork against damage as a consequence of a rupture of the mainspring
Adjusting the gear train, e.g. the backlash of the arbors, depth of meshing of the gears
Protection of the clockwork against damage from outside
Cases filled with gases or liquids
Cases containing substances for absorbing or binding moisture or dust
Mounting the clockwork in the case
Fixed mountings for pocket or wrist watches
Forming the passage for the winding stem through the case
Hermetic sealing of openings, joints, passages, or slits
of the back cover of pocket or wrist watches
Cases for special purposes, e.g. watch combined with ring, watch combined with button
titlePart.entryReference: watches combined with cosmetic powder containers

titlePart.text: Suspending devices, supports, or stands for time-pieces in so far as they form part of the case
Fastening the case to the bracelet
Materials or processes of manufacturing pocket watch or wrist watch cases
Locking or holding devices for pendulums, chimes, etc., for use during transport
Protecting clockworks by shields or other means against external influences, e.g. magnetic fields
Time-pieces of which the indicating means or cases provoke special effects, e.g. aesthetic effect
Time-pieces of which the clockwork is visible partly or wholly
Time-pieces with invisible drive, e.g. with hands attached to rotating glass disc
TIME-PIECES COMBINED WITH OTHER articles which do not interfere with the running or the time-keeping of the time-piece
titlePart.entryReference: combined with cameras, projectors, or photographic printing apparatus

titlePart.text: Installations within mirrors, pictures, furniture, or other household articles
with attached ornaments or amusement apparatus
with attached measuring instruments, e.g. pedometer, barometer, thermometer, compass
Time-pieces using the position of the sun, moon, or stars
